data.author: Henri Matisse
data.quote: Creativity takes courage.

data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
data.quote: Every artist was first an amateur.

data.author: Bob Ross
data.quote: We don't make mistakes, just happy little accidents.

data.author: Vincent Van Gogh
data.quote: I am seeking, I am striving, I am in it with all my heart.

data.author: Andy Warhol
data.quote: They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.quote: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.

data.author: Auguste Rodin
data.quote: The main thing is to be moved, to love, to hope, to tremble, to live.

data.author: Henry Moore
data.quote: To be an artist is to believe in life.

data.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
data.quote: Whether you succeed or not is irrelevant, there is no such thing.  Making your unknown known is the important thing.

data.author: Eugene Delecroix
data.quote: What moves men of genius, or rather what inspires their work, is not new ideas, but their obsession with the idea that what has already been said is still not enough.

data.author: Marc Chagall
data.quote: If I create from the heart, nearly everything works; if from the head, almost nothing.

data.author: Andy Warhol
data.quote: Don’t think about making art, just get it done.  Let everyone else decide if it’s good or bad, whether they love it or hate it.  While they are deciding, make even more art.

data.author: Michaelangelo
data.quote: If people knew how hard I worked to get my mastery, it wouldn't seem so wonderful at all.

data.author: Lenoardo da Vinci
data.quote: One can have no smaller or greater mastery than mastery of oneself.

data.author: Schumann
data.quote: To send light into the darkness of men's hearts - such is the duty of the artist.

data.author: Vincent van Gogh
data.quote: Great things are done by a series of small things brought together.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.quote: Inspiration does exist but it must find you working.

data.author: Henry David Thoreau
data.quote: It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see.

data.author: Andy Warhol
data.quote: Everything has its beauty, but not everyone sees it.

data.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
data.quote: The world of reality has its limits; the world of imagination is boundless.
